smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. All 19 diagrams contain at least one element.

On page 2 (Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem - Vaata & Tuvasta), the use case 'Tuvasta kasutaja' appears inside the system boundary but has no visible association line to any of the actors (Uudistaja, Klienditeenindaja, Juhataja, Klient, Autode haldur). The 'Süsteem' element is marked as '(from Läbivad huvid)' indicating it's a cross-cutting concern reference, not an actor with association to this use case.

No duplicate use case names with the same actor were found. All use cases across pages 2-3 have unique names: Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet, Registreeri auto, Lõpeta auto, Muuda autot, Aktiveeri auto, Muuda auto mittaktiivseks, Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid, Unusta auto.
No duplicate element names within the same package were found. Each package (Autode register, Isikute register, Klassifikaatorite register, etc.) contains uniquely named elements.

No redundant data copies without FK relationships were found. Common columns like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appear across different classifier tables but represent different contexts (different entity types). All data relationships between tables are connected via proper FK relationships as shown in database diagrams on pages 14-19.

All use cases follow consistent verb-first naming pattern in Estonian: Tuvasta (Identify), Vaata (View), Registreeri (Register), Lõpeta (End), Muuda (Change), Aktiveeri (Activate), Unusta (Forget). No noun-first naming was found.

On page 9 (Auto seisundidiagramm), all states are reachable: Ootel is reached from Algus, Aktiivne is reached from Ootel, Mitteaktiivne is reached from Aktiivne, Lõpetatud is reached from both Aktiivne and Mitteaktiivne, and Unustatud is reached from Ootel. No unreachable states exist.

On page 4 (Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm), all actions are reachable from the start node 'Algus'. The flow proceeds through 'Vaata kõiki autosid...', decision points, 'Otsi autot', 'Vali auto', 'Lõpeta valitud auto' with proper connections throughout.

All association relationships in class and database diagrams have multiplicity indicators on both ends. Examples: Page 5 shows '1 0..*' for Töötaja-Auto relationships; Page 6 shows '1 0..1' and '0..* 1' for Isik relationships; Database diagrams (pages 14-19) consistently show multiplicities like '0..* 1', '0..1 1' on all FK relationships.

Counted central elements on each diagram: Page 2: 4 use cases; Page 3: 7 use cases; Page 4: 8 actions; Page 5: 3 classes; Page 6: 6 classes; Page 7: 6 classes; Page 8: 6 classes; Page 9: 5 states; Page 10: 5 classes; Page 11: 3 classes; Page 12: 7 classes; Page 13: 3 classes; Page 14: 4 tables; Page 15: 9 tables; Page 16: 3 tables; Page 17: 6 tables; Page 18: 2 tables; Page 19: 5 tables. Maximum is 9 tables on page 15. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

Counted visual connection lines per element on class/database diagrams. Maximum connections found: Page 6 - Isik has 5 lines; Page 12 - Auto has 4 lines; Page 14 - Isik has 3 lines; Page 17 - Auto has 4 lines; Page 19 - Tootaja has 4 lines. Maximum across all diagrams is 5 lines. Threshold is ≥6. Since 5 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows that related elements are positioned reasonably close together. No relationship distance appears to exceed twice the average distance between elements. Diagrams are well-organized with connected elements grouped appropriately.

All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs in Estonian: Tuvasta (Identify), Vaata (View), Registreeri (Register), Lõpeta (End), Muuda (Change), Aktiveeri (Activate), Unusta (Forget), Otsi (Search), Vali (Select). No noun-first or passive forms found.

All names have ≥4 characters. Shortest class/table names: Isik (4), Auto (4), Riik (4). All attribute/column names are compound or longer than 3 characters: e_meil, eesnimi, isikukood, nimetus, mudel, parool, etc. Threshold is ≤3. No names with ≤3 characters found.

All class names start with uppercase and are singular: Isik, Auto, Kasutajakonto, Töötaja, Klient, Klassifikaator, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Auto_kütuse_liik, Riik, etc. No lowercase-starting or plural class names found.

All attribute/column names start with lowercase: e_meil, eesnimi, elukoht, isikukood, perenimi, reg_aeg, synni_kp, viimase_muutm_aeg, on_aktiivne, parool, nimetus, mudel, auto_kood, isik_id, etc. No uppercase-starting attribute names found.

All database table names are singular: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Tootaja, Klient, Auto, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_seisundi_liik, Riik, Tootaja_roll, Tootaja_rolli_omamine, etc. No plural table names found.

No type prefixes (tbl_, uc_, str, int, etc.) found in class, table, or attribute names. Prefixes like PK_, FK_, pfK, IXFK_ are present but these are allowed indicators for primary keys, foreign keys, and indexes per the rule specification.
